cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn N-NE, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend Thursday, then accelerate NE across south-central Georgia and the coastal Carolinas before moving out over the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Anclote River to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, then southeast Georgia and South Carolina coasts including the Port of Savannah area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, gusts to 50 mph) possible Thursday night into Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along the Georgia coast and in the Savannah River estuary at peak tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce 3–6 inches with localized amounts above 6 inches, causing urban and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands and reduced visibility/seas >8 ft for inbound/outbound vessels.
